main event: An object was visually observed in the sky over L.G. Hanscom Field, Massachusetts on February 7, 1961.
interesting points: The sighting lasted between 2 to 3 minutes, The object was described as an oval, half dollar size and white in color, The object's path was noted and it moved horizontally at a constant rate for approximately 1 hour before disappearing, The object was identified as potentially a satellite and also noted to resemble the planet Venus, The object disappeared like the setting sun, going below the horizon.
witness description: Military personnel observing the object from L.G. Hanscom Field.
